body: @apolcyn do you think the header shuffling that went on in Core may have caused this?

Further up the log, I'm seeing these errors, which appear to be transient infrastructure flakes:

```
Entering 'third_party/abseil-cpp'
Submodule 'third_party/abseil-cpp' (https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp) registered for path 'third_party/abseil-cpp'
Cloning into '/var/local/git/grpc/third_party/abseil-cpp'...
Submodule path 'third_party/abseil-cpp': checked out 'cc4bed2d74f7c8717e31f9579214ab52a9c9c610'
Entering 'third_party/benchmark'
Submodule 'third_party/benchmark' (https://github.com/google/benchmark) registered for path 'third_party/benchmark'
Cloning into '/var/local/git/grpc/third_party/benchmark'...
fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/google/benchmark/': SSL connect error
fatal: clone of 'https://github.com/google/benchmark' into submodule path '/var/local/git/grpc/third_party/benchmark' failed
Failed to clone 'third_party/benchmark'. Retry scheduled
Cloning into '/var/local/git/grpc/third_party/benchmark'...
fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/google/benchmark/': SSL connect error
fatal: clone of 'https://github.com/google/benchmark' into submodule path '/var/local/git/grpc/third_party/benchmark' failed
Failed to clone 'third_party/benchmark' a second time, aborting
Stopping at 'third_party/benchmark'; script returned non-zero status.
+ FAILED=true
+ '[' artifacts '!=' '' ']'
+ docker cp build_and_run_docker_37e9a1bc-5026-4c76-8f3e-97811468e9e2:/var/local/git/grpc/artifacts /tmpfs/src/github/grpc
Error response from daemon: Could not find the file /var/local/git/grpc/artifacts in container build_and_run_docker_37e9a1bc-5026-4c76-8f3e-97811468e9e2
+ FAILED=true
+ docker rm -f build_and_run_docker_37e9a1bc-5026-4c76-8f3e-97811468e9e2
build_and_run_docker_37e9a1bc-5026-4c76-8f3e-97811468e9e2
+ '[' true '!=' '' ']'
+ exit 1

2018-02-22 11:19:27,143 FAILED: build_artifact.protoc_linux_x86 [ret=1, pid=9353, time=118.5sec]
```

for protoc build,

and this for what I think is during the python build:

```
+ docker run -e PIP=/opt/python/cp36-cp36m/bin/pip -e SETARCH_CMD=linux32 -e ARTIFACTS_OUT=artifacts/python_linux_x86_cp36-cp36m -e CFLAGS=-DGPR_MANYLINUX1=1 -e GRPC_BUILD_MANYLINUX_WHEEL=TRUE -e PYTHON=/opt/python/cp36-cp36m/bin/python -e GRPC_BUILD_GRPCIO_TOOLS_DEPENDENTS=TRUE -e RUN_COMMAND=tools/run_tests/artifacts/build_artifact_python.sh -e EXTERNAL_GIT_ROOT=/var/local/jenkins/grpc -e 'THIS_IS_REALLY_NEEDED=see https://github.com/docker/docker/issues/14203 for why docker is awful' -v /tmpfs/src/github/grpc:/var/local/jenkins/grpc:ro -w /var/local/git/grpc --name=build_and_run_docker_07255a60-d2af-4e64-bb87-b7f4fc96e0be grpctesting/grpc_artifact_python_manylinux_x86_3b9bca4a7b51e892d78f56d3f3bac8d4375808fa /bin/bash -l /var/local/jenkins/grpc/tools/run_tests/dockerize/docker_run.sh
+ '[' '' == '' ']'
+ mkdir -p /var/local/git
+ git clone /var/local/jenkins/grpc /var/local/git/grpc
Cloning into '/var/local/git/grpc'...
done.
+ cd /var/local/jenkins/grpc
+ git submodule foreach 'cd /var/local/git/grpc \
  && git submodule update --init --reference ${EXTERNAL_GIT_ROOT}/${name} \
  ${name}'
Entering 'third_party/abseil-cpp'
Submodule 'third_party/abseil-cpp' (https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp) registered for path 'third_party/abseil-cpp'
Cloning into 'third_party/abseil-cpp'...
fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp/': error:1407742E:SSL routines:SSL23_GET_SERVER_HELLO:tlsv1 alert protocol version
Clone of 'https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp' into submodule path 'third_party/abseil-cpp' failed
Stopping at 'third_party/abseil-cpp'; script returned non-zero status.
```
@matt-kwong Looks like https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/14504 has fixed the issue on Kokoro, but Jenkins still faces an infra issue (similar to the older ones we faced that related to caching)
@matt-kwong nevermind, the error seems to have gone away on Jenkins too.
